data.description: Weaponize.it is your go-to resource for gaining insights into ethical hacking, pentesting, bug bounty hunting, and scripting. Explore a curated collection of powerful and practical tips and tricks related to cybersecurity, programming, and system exploitation.

The website was designed to provide you a collection of guides, one-liners, cheatsheets and code snippets to make your life as a hacker easier. Quickly search for keywords and find what suits you best.
Join us on GitHub and feel free to contribute with your own scripts, one-liners, functions or techniques.

Quite often, in the midst of my pentests or during CTFs, I find myself in the search for a script I used ages ago, or I end up scrolling through numerous commands in the terminal history, attempting to recall what I need, or navigating through a cluster of 10 cheatsheets just to find that one specific command.
Using Weaponize.it, I can simply input keywords relevant to my desired information into the search bar, and instantaneously search through community-contributed data.

title: Extract all endpoints from a javascript file

data.command: cat files.txt | grep -aoP "(?<=("|\'|`))\/[a-zA-Z0-9?&=\/-#.](?=("|\'|`))" | sort -u | tee output.txt

title: Emulate a MySQL interactive shell
description: PHP script to emulate a MySQL interactive shell in a host. Use it if there is no MySQL client available.

data.command:
<?php

$host = 'localhost';
$username = 'your_username';
$password = 'your_password';
$database = 'your_database';

$mysqli = new mysqli($host, $username, $password, $database);

if ($mysqli->connect_error)
    die("Connection failed: " . $mysqli->connect_error);

echo "Connected to MySQL. Type 'exit' to quit.
";

while(1){
    $input = readline("mysql> ");
    
    if($input === 'exit')
        break;

    $result = $mysqli->query($input);

    if(!$result)
        echo "Error: " . $mysqli->error . "
";
    else{
        if($result->num_rows > 0){
            while($row = $result->fetch_assoc())
                print_r($row);
        }else{
            echo "Query OK, " . $mysqli->affected_rows . " rows affected
";
        }
        $result->free();
    }        
}

$mysqli->close();
echo "Exited MySQL shell.
";

title: Crack zip file password
description: Extract the hash of a zip file and crack it based on a wordlist

data.command:
zip2john file.zip > hash.txt
john hash.txt
john hash.txt --show

title: Repack Android app
description: Repack an Android app, sign it an reinstall on the device

data.description: Usage: repack <folder where apk was extracted to>
data.command:
function repack(){
	name=$(echo -n "$1" | sed "s/\///g")
	package_name=$(grep "package="" "${name}/AndroidManifest.xml"  | sed -E "s/.*package="([^"]+)".*/\1/g")
 	echo "[*] Repacking..."
 	java -jar /opt/apktool_2.6.1.jar b "$1" -o "${name}.apk"
	echo -e  "
[*] Signing..."
	java -jar /opt/uber-apk-signer-1.2.1.jar -a "${name}.apk" -o "${name}_signed"
	mv "${name}_signed/${name}-aligned-debugSigned.apk" ${name}_signed.apk
	rm -r "${name}_signed/"
	echo -e "
[*] Uninstalling old $package_name..."
	adb uninstall $package_name
	echo -e "
[*] Installing ${name}_signed.apk..."
	adb install "${name}_signed.apk"
}

title: List the last 10 files modified on a folder

data.command: find $1 -type f -exec stat --format '%Y :%y %n' "{}" \; | sort -nr | cut -d: -f2- | head

title: Extract endpoints and URLs from Android apk

data.command: apktool d <app.apk>; cd app;mkdir collection; find . -name \*.smali -exec sh -c "cp {} collection/\$(head /dev/urandom | md5 | cut -d' ' -f1).smali" \;; linkfinder -i 'collection/*.smali' -o cli
